till a lot later, huh, Darla?

248
00:25:15,835 --> 00:25:19,862
She's busy. Go play with your dolls
or something, okay?

249
00:25:19,939 --> 00:25:22,271
I don't have any dolls.

250
00:25:22,342 --> 00:25:25,709
Get some food, huh?

251
00:25:25,779 --> 00:25:28,771
Somebody already bought me dinner.
The police.

252
00:25:34,454 --> 00:25:38,151
- "Somebody already bought me dinner.
The police."
- [ Laughing ]

253
00:25:48,168 --> 00:25:51,399
Thirty, forty dollars.

254
00:25:53,173 --> 00:25:55,607
Who the fuck is this now?

255
00:25:55,675 --> 00:25:59,839
Hey! Piss off!
We're closed!

256
00:25:59,913 --> 00:26:02,575
- Cerrado!
- [ Pounding ]

257
00:26:02,649 --> 00:26:06,483
Sleep it off somewhere else, dusthead,
unless you want to get mutilated.

258
00:26:11,991 --> 00:26:14,016
[ Muttering ]

259
00:26:14,093 --> 00:26:18,359
Goddamn creatures of the night,
they never learn.

260
00:26:20,066 --> 00:26:21,795
Hey! Hey!

261
00:26:23,837 --> 00:26:25,930
- [ Cawing ]
- [ Screams ]

262
00:26:26,005 --> 00:26:30,374
"Suddenly I heard
a tapping, as if someone...

263
00:26:30,443 --> 00:26:34,379
gently rapping,
rapping at my chamber door."

264
00:26:36,349 --> 00:26:38,647
What are you talking about?

265
00:26:38,718 --> 00:26:41,448
You heard me rapping, right?

266
00:26:41,521 --> 00:26:45,651
You're trespassing,
and you owe me a fuckin' new door!

267
00:26:48,061 --> 00:26:51,053
I'm looking for something
in an engagement ring.

268
00:26:51,130 --> 00:26:52,495
Gold.

269
00:26:52,565 --> 00:26:54,897
You're looking for a coroner,
shit-for-brains.

270
00:26:59,172 --> 00:27:04,303
Oh, shit.
Oh, shit on me!

271
00:27:04,377 --> 00:27:06,902
Shit on me.
Shit on me!

272
00:27:13,052 --> 00:27:15,316
- Aaah!
- Mr. Gideon.

273
00:27:15,388 --> 00:27:17,652
You're not paying attention.

274
00:27:20,560 --> 00:27:22,721
No! [ Screaming ]

275
00:27:22,795 --> 00:27:28,097
I repeat, a gold
engagement ring, yes?

276
00:27:29,736 --> 00:27:33,194
It was pawned here a year ago
by a customer of yours named Tin Tin.

277
00:27:35,909 --> 00:27:39,572
He confided in me
before he ran out of breath.

278
00:27:39,646 --> 00:27:42,809
[ Helicopter Departing ]

279
00:27:44,884 --> 00:27:46,875
Who's this sack of shit?

280
00:27:46,953 --> 00:27:49,922
That's Tin Tin, one of
T-bird's little helpers.

281
00:27:49,989 --> 00:27:53,049
I think you can rule out
accidental death.

282
00:27:53,126 --> 00:27:55,924
Don't any of your street demons
have real grown-up names?

283
00:27:55,995 --> 00:28:00,159
This could be a turf hit, but it doesn't
look like your usual gang crap.

284
00:28:00,233 --> 00:28:04,966
Come on, Albrecht, spare me.
You're a beat cop now, so be a beat cop.

285
00:28:05,038 --> 00:28:06,972
I'm suppose to thank you
for that, right?

286
00:28:07,040 --> 00:28:10,806
Word to the wise:
Watch your fuckin' mouth.

287
00:28:12,011 --> 00:28:14,411
What the hell
do you call that?

288
00:28:15,481 --> 00:28:18,075
I call it blood, detective.

289
00:28:18,151 --> 00:28:21,917
I suppose you'll write it up
as graffiti.

290
00:28:21,988 --> 00:28:24,752
You can leave
my crime scene now, okay?

291
00:28:24,824 --> 00:28:28,817
[ Helicopter Approaching ]

292
00:28:31,499 --> 00:28:34,400
- Warmer?
- What are you doing?

293
00:28:34,469 --> 00:28:37,097
- Don't you know this game?
- What game?

294
00:28:37,172 --> 00:28:40,073
Okay, the rings!
I'll tell you about the rings!

295
00:28:40,141 --> 00:28:44,544
They're in that metal box!
It's under the shelf there!

296
00:28:44,613 --> 00:28:50,142
Take the fucking rings!
Choke on them, you son of a bitch!

297
00:28:53,722 --> 00:28:56,316
- Look, it goes to the attic.
- Okay.

298
00:29:05,467 --> 00:29:07,492
No, no.

299
00:29:07,569 --> 00:29:10,697
No, no, no.

300
00:29:13,174 --> 00:29:17,406
Oh, it's beautiful.
I don't believe it.

301
00:29:21,316 --> 00:29:23,682
Shelly.

302
00:29:31,860 --> 00:29:33,259
I love you.

303
00:29:38,333 --> 00:29:41,200
[ Groaning ]

304
00:29:41,269 --> 00:29:44,204
- You have one chance to live.
- Take anything you want.

305
00:29:44,272 --> 00:29:47,366
- Thank you.
- Take anything!

306
00:29:47,442 --> 00:29:50,309
Now you're going to tell me
where to find...

307
00:29:50,378 --> 00:29:53,006
the rest of Tin Tin's
little party pals.

308
00:29:53,081 --> 00:29:55,481
The Pit. They all
hang out at The Pit.

309
00:29:55,550 --> 00:30:00,647
T-birds's little potato-heads hang out
there. Funboy lives there upstairs.

310
00:30:00,722 --> 00:30:03,714
- Funboy.
- Oh, baby, oh.

311
00:30:03,792 --> 00:30:07,558
- A whole jolly club...
- Please!

312
00:30:07,629 --> 00:30:10,393
- with jolly pirate nicknames!
- Stop! Please!

313
00:30:10,465 --> 00:30:13,127
- Jesus Christ in a taxicab!
- Hold still!

314
00:30:14,803 --> 00:30:18,204
Each one of these is a life...

315
00:30:18,273 --> 00:30:20,798
a life you helped destroy.

316
00:30:20,875 --> 00:30:23,469
I'm begging you.
Don't kill me.

317
00:30:23,545 --> 00:30:27,242
I'm not gonna kill you.

318
00:30:27,315 --> 00:30:31,479
Your job will be to tell the rest
of them that death is coming for them...

319
00:30:31,553 --> 00:30:35,080
tonight.

320
00:30:40,128 --> 00:30:44,326
Tell them Eric Draven
sends his regards.

321
00:30:46,234 --> 00:30:50,295
You walk outta here,
they're gonna erase your sorry ass.

322
00:30:50,371 --> 00:30:54,000
You're nothing but street grease,
you motherfucker!

323
00:30:54,075 --> 00:30:56,236
Is that gasoline I smell?

324
00:30:56,311 --> 00:30:59,246
No, man, no!
No!

325
00:30:59,314 --> 00:31:01,373
No!

326
00:31:01,449 --> 00:31:02,780
No!

327
00:31:05,820 --> 00:31:08,448
[ Screaming ]

328
00:31:11,760 --> 00:31:16,629
[ Screaming ]

329
00:31:18,466 --> 00:31:21,924
It's on the house, kiddo,
you know that.

330
00:31:22,003 --> 00:31:24,267
One root beer.

331
00:31:26,307 --> 00:31:29,037
[ Bartender ] I can't do anything.

332
00:31:29,110 --> 00:31:33,570
Your mom... technically,
she's off right now.

333
00:31:33,648 --> 00:31:35,775
Yeah, way off.

334
00:31:36,951 --> 00:31:40,318
[ Tires Screeching, Door Opening ]

335
00:31:40,388 --> 00:31:45,291
Police! Don't move!
I said, "Don't move!"

336
00:31:45,360 --> 00:31:48,386
I thought the police
always said, "Freeze!"

337
00:31:48,463 --> 00:31:52,399
I am the police and I say don't move,
Snow White. You move, you're dead.

338
00:31:52,467 --> 00:31:57,632
And I say I'm dead and I move.

339
00:31:57,705 --> 00:32:01,004
Not one more step.
I'm serious.

340
00:32:01,075 --> 00:32:05,444
Then shoot, if you will,
Officer Albrecht.

341
00:32:05,513 --> 00:32:08,641
What are you, nuts?
Walking into a gun?

342
00:32:08,716 --> 00:32:10,445
You high?

343
00:32:10,518 --> 00:32:13,715
- You don't remember me?
- What are you talking about?

344
00:32:13,788 --> 00:32:17,781
How about Shelly?
Do you remember Shelly Webster?

345
00:32:17,859 --> 00:32:20,521
Shelly Webster's dead, my friend.

346
00:32:20,595 --> 00:32:25,191
I want you to move over to the curb,
nice and easy. Move it!

347
00:32:25,266 --> 00:32:30,101
Okay, we're gonna
wait here for backup.

348
00:32:30,171 --> 00:32:34,631
- It's gettin' too weird for me.
- Oh, it gets better.

349
00:32:34,709 --> 00:32:37,143
Do you know someone named T-bird?

350
00:32:37,212 --> 00:32:41,808
He had a friend who shouldn't have
played with knives. Like the coat?

351
00:32:41,883 --> 00:32:44,477
You're the guy
that murdered Tin Tin.

352
00:32:44,552 --> 00:32:48,044
- [ Looter ] Check it out.
- He was already dead.

353
00:32:48,122 --> 00:32:53,492
- [ Glass Shattering ]
- He died a year ago.
The moment he touched her.

354
00:32:53,561 --> 00:32:57,224
They're all dead.
They just don't know it yet.

355
00:32:57,298 --> 00:32:59,732
Get away from there!

356
00:32:59,801 --> 00:33:02,929
Cops!
Get outta here!

357
00:33:03,004 --> 00:33:06,405
- [ Woman Laughing ]
- [ Looter ] Leave it, run!

358
00:33:11,779 --> 00:33:16,113
- Oh, great, great.
- [ Siren Wailing ]

359
00:33:16,184 --> 00:33:18,778
Guy shows up looking like
a mime from hell...

360
00:33:18,853 --> 00:33:21,185
and you lose him
right out in the open.

361
00:33:21,256 --> 00:33:27,092
Well, at least he didn't do that walking
against the wind shit. I hate that.

362
00:33:27,161 --> 00:33:31,097
Little early
for Devil's Night.

363
00:33:32,667 --> 00:33:35,397
You are very restless.

364
00:33:35,470 --> 00:33:38,701
Just wish I was a little
hungry again, that's all.

365
00:33:38,773 --> 00:33:43,005
- Be careful of what you ask for.
- Yeah, I may get it, I know.

366
00:33:46,614 --> 00:33:49,208
[ Sizzling ]

367
00:33:49,284 --> 00:33:52,879
# [ Rock And Roll, Indistinct ] #

368
00:33:54,489 --> 00:33:57,515
There are energies
aligning against you.

369
00:33:57,592 --> 00:34:00,060
Seeing is believing,
isn't it?

370
00:34:07,001 --> 00:34:10,801
[ Door Opening, Closing ]

371
00:34:10,872 --> 00:34:13,864
Mmm, yummy.

372
00:34:19,213 --> 00:34:23,172
Gideon's pawnshop just burned down
to the foundation.

373
00:34:23,251 --> 00:34:26,482
Nobody cleared
this little event with me.

374
00:34:26,554 --> 00:34:28,317
I didn't have nothing
to do with that.

375
00:34:28,389 --> 00:34:31,051
[ Man ] You must be
awfully disappointed.

376
00:34:31,125 --> 00:34:34,458
I got trouble.
One of my crew got himself perished.

377
00:34:34,529 --> 00:34:36,827
- Yeah, who might that be?
- Tin Tin.

378
00:34:36,898 --> 00:34:41,460
Somebody stuck his blades in all his
major organs in alphabetical order.

379
00:34:41,536 --> 00:34:44,096
Gentlemen, by all means,
I think we ought to have...

380
00:34:44,172 --> 00:34:47,369
an introspective moment of silence
for poor, old Tin Tin.

381
00:34:50,044 --> 00:34:52,604
You're working for me
tomorrow night, right?

382
00:34:52,680 --> 00:34:55,478
- Whatever you say, I can do.
- Good.

383
00:34:55,550 --> 00:34:58,348
That's very reassuring.

384
00:34:58,419 --> 00:35:02,446
I still ain't heard
why Gideon's burned down.

385
00:35:02,523 --> 00:35:06,983
Is that a natural catastrophe
or act of God or something?

386
00:35:07,061 --> 00:35:08,926
Call it my need to know.

387
00:35:35,857 --> 00:35:37,722
[ Sighing ]

388
00:35:39,927 --> 00:35:42,452
[ Honking, Tires Screeching ]

389
00:35:42,530 --> 00:35:45,124
Let go, you creep!

390
00:35:48,436 --> 00:35:50,199
- Nah.
- [ Laughing ]

391
00:35:50,271 --> 00:35:53,570
You didn't even slow down,
you dickhead!

392
00:35:54,976 --> 00:35:57,376
He couldn't have stopped.

393
00:35:57,445 --> 00:36:01,745
He was a buttface.
I could have made it.

394
00:36:01,816 --> 00:36:04,876
What are you supposed to be,
a clown or something?

395
00:36:04,952 --> 00:36:06,943
Sometimes.

396
00:36:09,023 --> 00:36:13,756
It's more like surfing than skating.
I wish the rain would stop, just once.

397
00:36:14,929 --> 00:36:18,421
- It can't rain all the time.
- Eric?

398
00:36:27,756 --> 00:36:30,884
[ Phone Ringing ]

399
00:36:35,364 --> 00:36:39,960
Don't thank me.
Are we fighting the good fight?

400
00:36:40,035 --> 00:36:44,369
Double homicide a year ago.
No convictions.

401
00:36:44,440 --> 00:36:47,876
Annie... look at that.

402
00:36:47,943 --> 00:36:52,175
"We, the undersigned tenants of
1929 Caulderon Court Apartments--"

403
00:36:52,248 --> 00:36:54,307
What is this, a petition?

404
00:36:54,383 --> 00:36:57,250
Big "kick me" sign for a very nice girl
who found herself a cause.

405
00:36:57,319 --> 00:37:01,415
- The cause got her killed.
- She was fighting tenant eviction
in that neighborhood?

406
00:37:01,490 --> 00:37:07,395
Shelly Webster and her nice
rock-and-roll boyfriend, Eric Draven.

407
00:37:07,463 --> 00:37:11,024
The last time you snooped around a case
is when you got put back on the beat.

408
00:37:11,100 --> 00:37:15,093
- I know. Torres keeps reminding me.
- I bet he does.

409
00:37:22,111 --> 00:37:25,842
You're going to wind up
working a school crosswalk.

410
00:37:25,915 --> 00:37:28,042
I'm cool.

411
00:37:28,117 --> 00:37:32,850
You didn't get that file from me, okay?
And don't tell me you owe me one.

412
00:37:32,922 --> 00:37:35,413
Ah, I owe you one!

413
00:37:35,491 --> 00:37:37,516
Yeah, right.

414
00:37:37,593 --> 00:37:39,754
Damn.

415
00:37:53,342 --> 00:37:56,800
# [ Rock And Roll ] #

416
00:38:05,187 --> 00:38:09,055
Tomorrow night
we can get high...

417
00:38:09,124 --> 00:38:12,821
and watch this whole fucking city
burn from that window.

418
00:38:15,664 --> 00:38:18,792
-  # I am the park #
- [ Caws ]

419
00:38:18,867 --> 00:38:22,496
# I am glow #

420
00:38:22,571 --> 00:38:26,632
# In the motherfuckin' dark #

421
00:38:26,709 --> 00:38:28,870
# I am shocked #

422
00:38:28,944 --> 00:38:31,174
# And I see #

423
00:38:31,246 --> 00:38:34,409
# I don't want to believe #

424
00:38:34,483 --> 00:38:37,611
# No more #

425
00:38:37,686 --> 00:38:40,314
- There's a big fuckin' bird over there.
-  # No more #

426
00:38:40,689 --> 00:38:42,657
- Huh?
- [ Cawing ]

427
00:38:43,825 --> 00:38:46,726
- It's a squab.
- [ Laughing ]

428
00:38:46,795 --> 00:38:49,423
Come here, bird.

429
00:38:49,498 --> 00:38:51,591
Hey, bird.
Hey, bird.

430
00:38:51,667 --> 00:38:53,999
Bird. B-B-Birdie.

431
00:38:54,069 --> 00:38:56,663
Here, birdie, birdie.

432
00:38:56,738 --> 00:38:59,730
Come here, birdie,
birdie, birdie.

433
00:39:02,344 --> 00:39:05,575
Birdie? Hey, birdie?

434
00:39:05,647 --> 00:39:08,241
Here, Funboy.

435
00:39:10,552 --> 00:39:12,520
What the fuck?

436
00:39:16,325 --> 00:39:18,850
[ Strumming Guitar ]

437
00:39:18,927 --> 00:39:23,455
No, man! Don't do that! You nearly
gave me a fucking heart attack!

438
00:39:23,532 --> 00:39:25,693
Look at him.

439
00:39:25,767 --> 00:39:28,634
[ Funboy ] Don't sweat it.

440
00:39:30,339 --> 00:39:33,365
It's time for you to take
your bird and leave, freako.

441
00:39:41,283 --> 00:39:46,118
Take your shot, Funboy.
You got me dead bang.

442
00:39:48,123 --> 00:39:53,060
You are seriously fucked up.
Did you look in the mirror?

443
00:39:53,128 --> 00:39:56,655
You need professional help.

444
00:39:58,433 --> 00:40:01,027
- [ Groaning ]
- Bingo!

445
00:40:01,103 --> 00:40:03,731
He shoots! He scores!

446
00:40:05,907 --> 00:40:08,899
- [ Cawing ]
- [ Laughing ]

447
00:40:10,245 --> 00:40:13,806
[ Cheering, Laughing ]

448
00:40:13,882 --> 00:40:17,579
- Jesus Christ!
- Jesus Christ?

449
00:40:17,652 --> 00:40:20,382
Stop me if you heard this one.

450
00:40:20,455 --> 00:40:23,390
Jesus Christ
walks into a hotel.

451
00:40:23,458 --> 00:40:25,392
[ Whimpering ]

452
00:40:25,460 --> 00:40:27,257
Ow.

453
00:40:28,797 --> 00:40:31,561
He hands the innkeeper
three nails and he asks...

454
00:40:31,633 --> 00:40:35,194
Don't you ever fuckin' die?

455
00:40:35,270 --> 00:40:37,500
"Can you put me up for the night?"

456
00:40:37,572 --> 00:40:41,064
[ Groaning ]

457
00:40:43,011 --> 00:40:47,607
- Does that hurt?
- Fuck. Does it-- Fuck, does it hurt?

458
00:40:47,682 --> 00:40:49,741
Oh, God.

459
00:40:49,818 --> 00:40:53,914
Look what you've done
to my sheets.

460
00:40:55,824 --> 00:40:57,451
[ Gun Uncocking ]

461
00:41:03,865 --> 00:41:05,628
[ Crying ]

462
00:41:05,700 --> 00:41:09,261
[ Sobbing ]

463
00:41:18,146 --> 00:41:20,114
I've got a gun
in my pocket.

464
00:41:23,151 --> 00:41:25,881
You're happy to see me,
aren't you?

465
00:41:43,638 --> 00:41:47,506
Stay away!
Stay away from me!

466
00:41:48,977 --> 00:41:51,241
[ Screaming ]

467
00:41:55,383 --> 00:41:59,183
Look.

468
00:41:59,254 --> 00:42:03,748
Mother is the name for God
on the lips and hearts of all children.

469
00:42:03,825 --> 00:42:08,592
Do you understand?
Morphine is bad for you.

470
00:42:19,003 --> 00:42:23,804
Your daughter is out there
on the streets waiting for you.

471
00:42:53,571 --> 00:42:57,234
If I wanted ice,
I would have asked for ice!

472
00:42:57,308 --> 00:42:59,572
Now fill it up!

473
00:43:00,678 --> 00:43:04,045
Fill it up yourself, macho man.

474
00:43:04,115 --> 00:43:06,811
I really need this.

475
00:43:13,358 --> 00:43:15,326
All right.

476
00:43:15,393 --> 00:43:19,329
You burn yourself
playing with matches?

477
00:43:19,397 --> 00:43:21,991
- Fuck off.
- You have an appointment.

478
00:43:22,066 --> 00:43:24,534
- Well, shit on me.
- Drink up.

479
00:43:24,602 --> 00:43:27,537
This is a first.
Do I bow or do I curtsy?

480
00:43:27,605 --> 00:43:30,403
Get my friend here
a glass of blood.

481
00:43:30,475 --> 00:43:33,911
Oh! Hey, hey, hon!

482
00:43:33,978 --> 00:43:36,879
Hey, good night, Darla.

483
00:43:39,317 --> 00:43:43,014
- You stay put right there.
- [ Groaning ]

484
00:43:51,095 --> 00:43:54,553
Get away, steamhead.

485
00:44:11,115 --> 00:44:13,709
[ Groaning ]

486
00:44:13,785 --> 00:44:15,753
Shh.

487
00:44:25,697 --> 00:44:31,431
[ Man On Radio ] As you can see, I'm
on the corner of 27th and Washington...

488
00:44:31,502 --> 00:44:34,232
- [ Door Squeaking ]
- the site of last year's biggest
Devil's Night conflagration.

489
00:44:34,305 --> 00:44:37,297
It was exactly one year ago
that the building you see...

490
00:44:37,375 --> 00:44:40,310
across the street from me
was totally demolished by fire.

491
00:44:40,378 --> 00:44:42,539
The fire that was fought
by seven fire companies...

492
00:44:42,614 --> 00:44:44,741
but lost the lives
of two fire fighters.

493
00:44:44,816 --> 00:44:49,583
In fact, if it weren't for the constant
surveillance by the local police--

494
00:44:49,654 --> 00:44:52,589
Freeze!

495
00:44:52,657 --> 00:44:56,149
Jesus. Don't ever do that, man.

496
00:44:56,227 --> 00:44:58,195
[ Whispering ] Fuck.

497
00:45:00,164 --> 00:45:02,359
Good likeness.

498
00:45:02,433 --> 00:45:06,130
I saw your body, man.
You died. You got buried.

499
00:45:06,204 --> 00:45:08,468
You still have your hat on.

500
00:45:12,377 --> 00:45:14,470
I gotta sit down.

501
00:45:15,279 --> 00:45:17,213
Shi--

502
00:45:17,281 --> 00:45:20,148
[ Albrecht ] Holy Shit.

503
00:45:21,586 --> 00:45:24,248
Say...

504
00:45:24,322 --> 00:45:28,622
are you some kind of... ghost?

505
00:45:28,693 --> 00:45:30,661
Boo!

506
00:45:38,236 --> 00:45:42,798
I don't know what I am. I need you
to tell me what happened to us.

507
00:45:44,809 --> 00:45:48,870
You took a six-story swan dive
out of a window.

508
00:45:48,946 --> 00:45:52,040
She, ah, was beaten and raped.

509
00:45:52,116 --> 00:45:56,712
Died at the hospital.
Hey, you asked, man.

510
00:45:56,788 --> 00:45:59,416
Come on. Read the file.

511
00:45:59,490 --> 00:46:03,859
Shelly Webster held on
for 30 hours in intensive care.

512
00:46:03,928 --> 00:46:07,125
Her body finally just gave it up.

513
00:46:07,198 --> 00:46:11,066
I saw it.
I couldn't do jack for her.

514
00:46:20,945 --> 00:46:22,879
- Hey.
- Don't touch me!

515
00:46:22,947 --> 00:46:26,940
- [ Sobbing ]
- Hey.

516
00:46:28,352 --> 00:46:31,185
You okay?

517
00:46:31,255 --> 00:46:33,951
I saw her.

518
00:46:35,593 --> 00:46:38,892
I saw her
through your eyes.

519
00:46:38,963 --> 00:46:41,056
You stayed with her
the whole time.

520
00:46:41,132 --> 00:46:46,593
Yeah, well, you got to
understand something, all right?

521
00:46:46,671 --> 00:46:51,404
I was hoping
she'd come out of it, you know.

522
00:46:51,476 --> 00:46:54,411
Give me something
I could work with.

523
00:46:54,479 --> 00:46:56,709
Yeah.

524
00:46:56,781 --> 00:46:59,215
Look, I--

525
00:46:59,283 --> 00:47:01,774
Why didn't you do
something about it?

526
00:47:01,853 --> 00:47:05,186
You think any people in that building,
even the ones who signed the petition...

527
00:47:05,256 --> 00:47:08,714
would talk after
what happened to you?

528
00:47:08,793 --> 00:47:12,024
I kept asking
questions and...

529
00:47:12,096 --> 00:47:14,758
finally got busted for sticking
my nose where it wasn't wanted.

530
00:47:18,770 --> 00:47:20,738
This your wife?

531
00:47:20,805 --> 00:47:25,299
Yeah, we, uh-- Well, not anymore,
we're getting a divorce.

532
00:47:27,145 --> 00:47:30,114
It's funny.

533
00:47:30,181 --> 00:47:34,174
Little things used to mean
so much to Shelly.

534
00:47:34,252 --> 00:47:37,744
I used to think
they were kind of trivial.

535
00:47:37,822 --> 00:47:40,848
Believe me,
nothing is trivial.

536
00:47:50,468 --> 00:47:54,928
You shouldn't smoke these.
They'll kill you.

537
00:47:59,610 --> 00:48:02,807
You going to vanish
into thin air again?

538
00:48:06,450 --> 00:48:09,146
I thought I'd use
your front door.

539
00:48:12,190 --> 00:48:18,026
Look, man, I'm sorry as hell for what
happened to you and your girlfriend.

540
00:48:19,564 --> 00:48:21,896
Yeah.

541
00:48:26,437 --> 00:48:29,031
- [ Door Opening, Closing ]
- [ Whispering ] Yeah.

542
00:48:29,106 --> 00:48:32,633
[ Gideon ] I got stabbed!
I shot the son of a bitch!

543
00:48:32,710 --> 00:48:35,838
I watched the bullet hole
close by itself.

544
00:48:35,913 --> 00:48:38,973
And then my business
gets blown up real good.

545
00:48:39,050 --> 00:48:42,281
- Other than that, my day sucked.
- Yeah.

546
00:48:42,353 --> 00:48:44,878
I saw him too.
He had a guitar.

547
00:48:44,956 --> 00:48:49,393
He winked at me before he jumped out
a fourth-floor window like he had wings.

548
00:48:49,460 --> 00:48:54,488
He winked at ya?
Musicians.

549
00:48:54,565 --> 00:48:57,033
- What else did you see?
- So far I haven't heard...

550
00:48:57,101 --> 00:48:59,592
shit about what you're going to do
about all this crap!

551
00:48:59,670 --> 00:49:05,199
What do I get? My livelihood
got flushed and went swirling.

552
00:49:05,276 --> 00:49:08,040
You ain't lost everything.

553
00:49:08,112 --> 00:49:13,209
Yeah, and maybe you're not
such a big shot either! Ow! Jesus!

554
00:49:13,284 --> 00:49:16,879
Fair enough. Catch.

555
00:49:17,989 --> 00:49:20,423
Aah! Jesus.

556
00:49:20,491 --> 00:49:22,925
Say hello to the last fellow
who wouldn't cooperate with me.

557
00:49:22,994 --> 00:49:24,985
What're you tellin' me,
tellin' me this thing is real?

558
00:49:25,062 --> 00:49:28,725
All the power in the world
resides in the eyes, fella.

559
00:49:28,799 --> 00:49:32,758
Sometimes they're more useful
than the people who bear them.

560
00:49:32,837 --> 00:49:36,967
You're directly out of
your fucking mind! You know that!

561
00:49:37,041 --> 00:49:39,703
Yeah.

562
00:49:39,777 --> 00:49:44,942
Eyes see. It's one of the most important
things I learned from my sister.

563
00:49:45,016 --> 00:49:48,281
Sister? She's supposed to be
your sister? [ Laughing ]

564
00:49:48,352 --> 00:49:51,685
My father's daughter.
That's right.

565
00:49:51,756 --> 00:49:54,953
What's the matter,
you don't see the resemblance?

566
00:49:55,026 --> 00:49:57,290
Now, let's take it
from the top, friend.

567
00:49:57,361 --> 00:50:00,856
With a lot of detail.
What do you say?

568
00:50:00,989 --> 00:50:04,447
He had a bird with him.
Nearly pecked my face off.

569
00:50:04,526 --> 00:50:07,927
He told me to tell T-bird
that death was on its way.

570
00:50:07,996 --> 00:50:10,226
Whatever the fuck that means.

571
00:50:10,299 --> 00:50:14,065
Draven. He said his name
was Eric Draven.

572
00:50:15,170 --> 00:50:17,229
Want to relax
that thing now?

573
00:50:17,306 --> 00:50:21,970
This bird man, he just happened
to let you live, huh?

574
00:50:22,044 --> 00:50:26,413
You sure you ain't making all this up
just to save your own ass?

575
00:50:26,482 --> 00:50:29,178
I ain't makin' all this up.

576
00:50:29,251 --> 00:50:33,779
I ain't twisted
like you two fucks.

577
00:50:35,557 --> 00:50:37,684
All right.

578
00:50:42,331 --> 00:50:47,359
A boy and his bird.
Awful touching.

579
00:50:47,436 --> 00:50:51,099
Yeah. [ Laughing ]

580
00:50:57,613 --> 00:51:00,605
For fuck's sake, die, will ya?
Give me that thing.

581
00:51:07,556 --> 00:51:09,854
Thanks.

582
00:51:09,925 --> 00:51:12,223
Funboy said he saw
a black bird too.

583
00:51:12,294 --> 00:51:14,888
A big one.

584
00:51:14,963 --> 00:51:19,832
Then he choked to death
on his own blood.

585
00:51:19,902 --> 00:51:23,838
I'll have the janitor
come on up.

586
00:51:28,277 --> 00:51:30,438
[ Purring ]

587
00:51:30,512 --> 00:51:35,415
# [ Electric Guitar ] #

588
00:51:46,895 --> 00:51:50,695
[ Siren Wailing ]

589
00:52:19,928 --> 00:52:25,525
-  # [ Rock Playing ] #
- [ Crow Caws ]

590
00:52:25,601 --> 00:52:27,865
You again.

591
00:52:27,936 --> 00:52:30,302
You lost or hungry?

592
00:52:30,372 --> 00:52:33,170
- Hi.
- [ Caws ]

593
00:52:35,510 --> 00:52:37,444
# It can't rain all the time #

594
00:52:37,512 --> 00:52:42,040
[ Skipping ]
# Can't rain all the time #

595
00:52:51,126 --> 00:52:53,822
[ T-bird ] I don't know how many times I
gotta tell you. We're in this together!

596
00:52:53,895 --> 00:52:56,830
One part falls, it all falls!

597
00:52:56,898 --> 00:53:00,356
- You know how long it took us
to put this together?
- Yeah, a long time.

598
00:53:00,435 --> 00:53:02,995
That piece of ratshit made Tin Tin
into a fuckin' voodoo doll!

599
00:53:03,071 --> 00:53:05,164
Tin Tin was a dick.

600
00:53:05,240 --> 00:53:08,232
Tin Tin.
Sheesh.

601
00:53:08,310 --> 00:53:12,508
Fire it up! Fire it up!
Fire it up! Fire it up!

602
00:53:12,581 --> 00:53:14,515
Fire it up!

603
00:53:17,085 --> 00:53:19,178
No Funboy.

604
00:53:19,254 --> 00:53:23,190
Probably still...
bangin' away on Darla.

605
00:53:23,258 --> 00:53:26,193
- [ Grunting ]
- [ Whistles ]

606
00:53:28,563 --> 00:53:31,657
Smokes and road beers.
Be quick.

607
00:53:31,733 --> 00:53:33,724
I'm on it.

608
00:53:39,308 --> 00:53:44,610
[ Man Talking On Phone ]

609
00:53:44,680 --> 00:53:47,649
[ Sighs ]

610
00:53:51,853 --> 00:53:54,287
[ Cawing ]

611
00:54:04,399 --> 00:54:07,960
What the fuck are
you supposed to be, man?

612
00:54:08,036 --> 00:54:12,666
- [ Cawing ]
- I'm your passenger.

613
00:54:19,581 --> 00:54:21,708
Drive.

614
00:54:23,819 --> 00:54:26,754
[ Motor Starts ]

615
00:54:26,822 --> 00:54:28,619
What's all this
happy horseshit?

616
00:54:28,690 --> 00:54:30,817
- [ Tires Screeching ]
- Hey, T-bird! T-bird!

617
00:54:30,892 --> 00:54:34,157
- [ Horn Honking ]
- [ Screams ]

618
00:54:34,229 --> 00:54:36,163
[ Brakes Screeching ]

619
00:54:36,231 --> 00:54:39,496
- Oh, shit!
- What the fuck's the matter with you?

620
00:54:39,568 --> 00:54:43,561
Stupid asshair!
You hit my car!

621
00:54:43,638 --> 00:54:45,868
[ Groaning ]

622
00:54:50,545 --> 00:54:54,982
What do you want, man?
Money? Drugs? I got it.

623
00:54:56,585 --> 00:54:59,486
We could use you.
You did Tin Tin.

624
00:54:59,554 --> 00:55:02,648
- This is business, right?
- [ Gun Cocks ] Faster.

625
00:55:05,594 --> 00:55:09,792
You got that cream stuff?

626
00:55:09,865 --> 00:55:12,265
I hate this.
They can't even call it cream legally.

627
00:55:13,869 --> 00:55:16,838
- What in the crap--
- [ Tires Screech, Siren Wails ]

628
00:55:16,905 --> 00:55:19,100
[ Screaming ]

629
00:55:20,342 --> 00:55:23,175
Oh, look. Makin' us popular.

630
00:55:23,245 --> 00:55:25,941
When they flash us like that,
they ain't friends.

631
00:55:26,014 --> 00:55:31,452
[ Siren Wailing ]

632
00:55:31,520 --> 00:55:34,512
This is Vehicle 48. We got us
a big, old, red hot rod.

633
00:55:37,025 --> 00:55:39,186
Turn.

634
00:55:40,529 --> 00:55:43,293
You got something personal, amigo,
we can work it out.

635
00:55:43,365 --> 00:55:47,699
- Right? Huh?
- [ Crow Cawing ]

636
00:55:49,271 --> 00:55:51,739
[ Groans ]
Damn! Dead end!

637
00:55:51,807 --> 00:55:54,037
[ Cawing ]

638
00:55:57,145 --> 00:55:59,613
- [ Man ] Look out!
- [ Woman Screams ]

639
00:56:02,918 --> 00:56:05,148
Oh, my God!
Get outta the way!

640
00:56:16,231 --> 00:56:20,497
- [ Engine Rattling ]
- Holy shit! Goddamn foreign cars!

641
00:56:20,569 --> 00:56:24,096
[ Siren Wailing ]

642
00:56:24,172 --> 00:56:26,640
Shit! Shit!

643
00:56:33,782 --> 00:56:37,479
Oh, I hate this.
This ain't good.

644
00:56:38,920 --> 00:56:42,378
T-bird!
I got you, man!

645
00:56:42,457 --> 00:56:44,857
- Shit!
- [ Screaming ]

646
00:56:48,630 --> 00:56:53,658
[ Groaning, Car Door Chiming ]

647
00:56:58,240 --> 00:57:00,538
[ T-bird ] Remember?
Yeah, I remember everything.

648
00:57:00,609 --> 00:57:03,840
But I don't know what--
What? Huh? What?

649
00:57:03,912 --> 00:57:06,676
What are you talkin' about?
No, no, no, no, no.

650
00:57:06,748 --> 00:57:09,842
You mean that place downtown?
Yeah, I remember her.

651
00:57:09,918 --> 00:57:12,079
We needed to put some fear
into that little lady.

652
00:57:12,153 --> 00:57:15,418
She wasn't going along
with our tenant relocation program.

653
00:57:15,490 --> 00:57:19,085
And her idiot boyfriend shows up
and turns a simple sweep-and-clear...

654
00:57:19,160 --> 00:57:22,596
into a total cluster fuck!
Who gives a shit?

655
00:57:22,664 --> 00:57:25,929
It's ancient history!
Why? What do you want?

656
00:57:26,001 --> 00:57:30,904
What is it? What?
Speak to me. Speak!

657
00:57:32,507 --> 00:57:34,372
Did you send us
these complaints?

658
00:57:36,077 --> 00:57:39,410
Come here!
"Abashed the devil stood."

659
00:57:39,481 --> 00:57:41,847
Does it get you sweaty?

660
00:57:41,917 --> 00:57:47,116
I know you. I know you.
I knew I knew you.

661
00:57:47,188 --> 00:57:51,279
I knew I knew you.
But you ain't you.

662
00:57:51,412 --> 00:57:55,371
You can't be you. We put you through
the window. There ain't no coming back.

663
00:57:55,450 --> 00:57:58,886
This is the really real world.
There ain't no coming back.

664
00:57:58,953 --> 00:58:01,319
We killed you dead.
There ain't no coming back.

665
00:58:01,389 --> 00:58:05,849
[ Grunting, Muttering ]
T-bird--

666
00:58:05,927 --> 00:58:08,896
There ain't no coming back!
There ain't no coming back!

667
00:58:11,466 --> 00:58:15,630
- T-bird.
- [ T-bird Panting ]

668
00:58:15,703 --> 00:58:19,070
- [ Engine Revs ]
- "Abashed the devil stood...

669
00:58:19,140 --> 00:58:22,075
and felt how awful goodness is."

670
00:58:22,143 --> 00:58:25,044
"And felt how awful goodness is."

671
00:58:29,784 --> 00:58:33,777
[ Tires Squealing ]

672
00:58:39,093 --> 00:58:41,687
[ Gasping ]
T-bird. T-bird.

673
00:59:09,424 --> 00:59:12,723
[ Crow Caws ]

674
00:59:32,046 --> 00:59:34,344
[ Woman ] This is the 7:00 a.m. edition
of Action News.

675
00:59:34,415 --> 00:59:36,747
For over a decade,
the night before Halloween...

676
00:59:36,818 --> 00:59:41,187
has had a darker and deadlier nickname
in the inner city, "Devil's Night"...

677
00:59:41,255 --> 00:59:44,691
the name given to what has become
an annual plague of arson.

678
00:59:44,759 --> 00:59:50,129
Last year over 200 blazes were reported,
and 11 people lost their lives.

679
00:59:50,198 --> 00:59:55,363
Tonight may become the biggest
and deadliest Devil's Night ever.

680
00:59:55,436 --> 00:59:59,065
The mayor has firefighters
from all surrounding counties--

681
00:59:59,140 --> 01:00:02,940
Do you like them up or over?
I can't remember.

682
01:00:04,979 --> 01:00:07,709
What are you doing?
I don't even like eggs.

683
01:00:07,782 --> 01:00:12,719
- Wait, you loved eggs.
- Yeah, when I was five.

684
01:00:12,787 --> 01:00:16,917
So what do you want now?
Black coffee and cigarettes?

685
01:00:16,991 --> 01:00:20,324
So what did you take
to become mother of the year?

686
01:00:20,395 --> 01:00:25,492
Oh, it wasn't drugs.
Someone kind of woke me up.

687
01:00:25,566 --> 01:00:31,334
- Who?
- Oh, it was nuts.

688
01:00:31,406 --> 01:00:36,639
You're acting weird. Did you win
the lottery or something, Darla?

689
01:00:39,147 --> 01:00:43,447
Oh, forget it. I never was
too good at this mommy shit.

690
01:00:43,518 --> 01:00:45,713
Over easy.

691
01:00:47,822 --> 01:00:52,521
I like 'em
over easy... Mom.

692
01:01:03,104 --> 01:01:05,368
Hey, Albrecht.

693
01:01:05,440 --> 01:01:08,034
[ Sighs ]

694
01:01:08,109 --> 01:01:11,044
This is the third hit
in your hood in 24 hours.

695
01:01:11,112 --> 01:01:14,377
We just fished this out of the river.
He's fused to his own car.

696
01:01:14,449 --> 01:01:18,681
- We're gonna have to I.D. his teeth.
- His name is T-bird.

697
01:01:18,753 --> 01:01:20,687
Arson was his specialty.

698
01:01:20,755 --> 01:01:22,723
Looks like he zigged
when he should have zagged.

699
01:01:22,790 --> 01:01:26,726
- Case closed.
- Bull-fuckin'-shit.

700
01:01:26,794 --> 01:01:29,058
Come here.

701
01:01:32,800 --> 01:01:34,791
You're holding out on me.

702
01:01:34,869 --> 01:01:38,396
I got a goddamn vigilante killer
knocking off scumbags left and right...

703
01:01:38,473 --> 01:01:41,738
and you're covering up
for somebody.

704
01:01:41,809 --> 01:01:44,243
Who's the cartoon character
in the painted face?

705
01:01:44,312 --> 01:01:48,214
- You're the detective. You tell me.
- Okay.

706
01:01:48,282 --> 01:01:50,409
Gideon's blows all to hell and you're
having a chitchat with some weirdo...

707
01:01:50,485 --> 01:01:53,352
who winds up in T-bird's car
when it zigs instead of zags.

708
01:01:53,421 --> 01:01:56,390
Then you steal one of
my case files from homicide...

709
01:01:56,457 --> 01:01:58,391
and you're saying this is
just a fuckin' automobile accident?

710
01:01:58,459 --> 01:02:00,757
- Come on!
- Yeah. Good speech though.

711
01:02:00,828 --> 01:02:02,853
I didn't want to interrupt you.
It sounded good.

712
01:02:02,930 --> 01:02:04,898
You gotta write that shit down.

713
01:02:04,966 --> 01:02:06,900
All right, smart-ass.

714
01:02:06,968 --> 01:02:10,028
The captain's got a little
love note waiting for you.

715
01:02:10,104 --> 01:02:14,040
- Welcome to the first day
of the rest of your suspension.
- Suspension?

716
01:02:14,108 --> 01:02:17,839
- For what?
- Misconduct.

717
01:02:17,912 --> 01:02:21,939
[ Dials Phone ]
Yeah, give me the lab.

718
01:02:22,016 --> 01:02:26,612
[ Thunder Rumbling ]

719
01:02:36,864 --> 01:02:38,798
[ Grunting ]

720
01:03:04,992 --> 01:03:08,894
# [ Electric Guitar ] #

721
01:03:12,667 --> 01:03:15,261
[ Shelly ] One for sorrow,
two for joy...

722
01:03:15,336 --> 01:03:18,169
- Come here.
- ...three for a girl, four for a boy.

723
01:03:23,211 --> 01:03:27,011
Dancing--

724
01:03:37,258 --> 01:03:39,988
[ Paper Ripping ]

725
01:03:58,145 --> 01:04:00,079
Eric?

726
01:04:00,147 --> 01:04:02,741
[ Rain Falling ]

727
01:04:02,817 --> 01:04:07,083
[ Sighs ] Man, Sarah,
you're going crazy.

728
01:04:07,154 --> 01:04:10,089
- Gabriel.
- [ Meows ]

729
01:04:10,157 --> 01:04:12,921
I thought you were dead.

730
01:04:12,994 --> 01:04:16,259
You're not dead, are you?

731
01:04:41,022 --> 01:04:43,957
I knew it was you.

732
01:04:45,860 --> 01:04:48,795
Even with the makeup.

733
01:04:53,634 --> 01:04:56,228
I remembered your song.

734
01:04:56,304 --> 01:05:00,070
You said,
"Can't rain all the time."

735
01:05:00,141 --> 01:05:03,406
That is from your song, right?

736
01:05:13,321 --> 01:05:16,449
- [ Cawing ]
- Come on, Eric. I know you're here.

737
01:05:18,826 --> 01:05:22,922
I miss you...
and Shelly.

738
01:05:26,000 --> 01:05:29,436
Get so lonely
all by myself.

739
01:05:31,305 --> 01:05:35,935
The hell with you.
I thought you cared.

740
01:05:36,010 --> 01:05:39,138
Sarah, I do care.

741
01:05:50,346 --> 01:05:52,473
That's him.
That's him!

742
01:05:52,549 --> 01:05:55,882
But he looked different. He was painted
up white like some kind of dead whore.

743
01:05:55,952 --> 01:05:59,217
I seen him. T-bird sent me in
for some road beers, right?

744
01:05:59,289 --> 01:06:01,849
Then he took him away.
But I chased him down.

745
01:06:01,925 --> 01:06:04,723
And he flash fried T-bird
to his fuckin' car!

746
01:06:04,794 --> 01:06:08,321
Aw, T-bird!
Here's to you, buddy.

747
01:06:08,398 --> 01:06:12,334
Maybe we oughta just videotape this.
Play it back in slow motion.

748
01:06:13,636 --> 01:06:18,232
- Fire it up! Fire it up!
- You see the grave?

749
01:06:18,308 --> 01:06:20,902
- Empty.
- Fire it--

750
01:06:20,977 --> 01:06:22,911
Grave?
What grave?

751
01:06:22,979 --> 01:06:25,209
What about
my fuckin' grave?

752
01:06:25,281 --> 01:06:26,612
- [ Screams ]
- Three out of four.

753
01:06:26,683 --> 01:06:29,948
He's working his way back
to this speed freak right here.

754
01:06:30,019 --> 01:06:32,681
It's not fair.
It's Funboy's fault.

755
01:06:32,755 --> 01:06:35,918
That boy was out of control.
T-bird, he came in, he says...
[ Whistles ]

756
01:06:35,992 --> 01:06:39,291
..."Waste them both." And now
this ghost gonna kill my ass next!

757
01:06:39,362 --> 01:06:43,264
[ Groaning ]

758
01:06:43,333 --> 01:06:46,427
This ghost gonna
kill my ass next.

759
01:06:46,503 --> 01:06:50,269
- This ghost gonna kill--
- Hey.

760
01:06:50,340 --> 01:06:52,308
That ain't no ghost.

761
01:06:54,210 --> 01:06:57,373
- They have all arrived.
- Watch him.

762
01:06:57,447 --> 01:06:59,438
We might need him.

763
01:07:00,950 --> 01:07:03,384
Ghost gonna kill my--

764
01:07:16,132 --> 01:07:20,068
He like his plain
or with onions?

765
01:07:20,136 --> 01:07:23,572
Fine.
Don't talk to me.

766
01:07:23,640 --> 01:07:27,736
When someone's dead,
they can't come back, can they?

767
01:07:27,810 --> 01:07:30,404
That's what I thought.

768
01:07:30,480 --> 01:07:33,244
Are you referring
to anyone in particular?

769
01:07:33,316 --> 01:07:35,580
You'll just think
I'm nuts.

770
01:07:35,652 --> 01:07:39,247
Yeah, well, then maybe
they'll have to lock us both up.

771
01:07:39,322 --> 01:07:44,692
- You see him too?
- I saw somebody.

772
01:07:44,761 --> 01:07:48,253
Maybe it was
your fairy godfather.

773
01:07:48,331 --> 01:07:51,266
Eric didn't come back for me.

774
01:07:51,334 --> 01:07:56,101
He can't be my friend anymore
because I'm alive.

775
01:07:56,172 --> 01:07:59,369
You want a friend
to walk you home?

776
01:07:59,442 --> 01:08:04,675
# [ Electric Guitar ] #

777
01:08:29,872 --> 01:08:32,864
- [ Screaming ]
- # I am the wicked
I am the wave of the future #

778
01:08:45,955 --> 01:08:47,889
[ Woman ]  # Being crucified #

779
01:08:47,957 --> 01:08:52,257
# You things, things
things of the flesh #

780
01:08:52,328 --> 01:08:55,024
# Do it slow #

781
01:08:55,098 --> 01:08:59,398
# Down avenues "cut me" #

782
01:08:59,469 --> 01:09:03,166
# Lust my eyes #

783
01:09:03,239 --> 01:09:09,508
# Licking lips encouraging
Mr. Careworn #

784
01:09:09,579 --> 01:09:15,711
# To gaze upon the screen bask on #

785
01:09:15,785 --> 01:09:17,810
# After the flesh #

786
01:09:29,799 --> 01:09:33,394
[ Whimpering ]

787
01:09:33,469 --> 01:09:36,404
Boys.

788
01:09:36,472 --> 01:09:39,908
It seems our friend T-bird won't be
joining us this evening...

789
01:09:39,976 --> 01:09:42,069
on account of
a slight case of death.

790
01:09:42,145 --> 01:09:44,113
- [ Men Chuckling ]
- You wanna sit down?

791
01:09:44,180 --> 01:09:49,550
- [ Groaning ]
- Well, well, well.

792
01:09:49,619 --> 01:09:52,679
Devil's Night is
upon us again.

793
01:09:52,755 --> 01:09:54,689
I thought we'd throw
a little party...

794
01:09:54,757 --> 01:09:58,022
start a bunch of fires,
make a little profit.

795
01:09:58,094 --> 01:10:00,324
I like the pretty lights.

796
01:10:00,396 --> 01:10:03,263
[ Laughing ]

797
01:10:03,332 --> 01:10:07,234
Problem is, it's all been done before.
You see what I'm saying?

798
01:10:07,303 --> 01:10:12,502
- That's no reason to quit.
- Wrong. Best reason to quit.

799
01:10:12,575 --> 01:10:14,975
Only reason to quit.

800
01:10:15,044 --> 01:10:20,539
A man has an idea.

801
01:10:20,616 --> 01:10:22,880
The idea attracts others...

802
01:10:22,952 --> 01:10:25,045
like-minded.

803
01:10:25,121 --> 01:10:27,214
The idea expands.

804
01:10:27,290 --> 01:10:30,953
The idea becomes
an institution.

805
01:10:31,027 --> 01:10:33,689
What was the idea?

806
01:10:33,763 --> 01:10:37,529
See, that's what's
been bothering me, boys.

807
01:10:37,600 --> 01:10:40,398
But I'll tell ya, when I used
to think about the idea itself...

808
01:10:40,470 --> 01:10:43,564
it'd put a big old smile on my face.

809
01:10:43,639 --> 01:10:45,834
You see, gentlemen...

810
01:10:45,908 --> 01:10:50,902
greed is for amateurs.

811
01:10:50,980 --> 01:10:56,179
Disorder, chaos, anarchy...

812
01:10:56,252 --> 01:10:58,846
now that's fun!

813
01:10:58,921 --> 01:11:01,219
- What about Devil's Night?
- What about it?

814
01:11:01,290 --> 01:11:04,691
I started the first fires
in this goddamn city.

815
01:11:04,761 --> 01:11:07,855
Before I knew it, every charlatan
and shitheel was imitating me.

816
01:11:07,930 --> 01:11:11,366
Do you know
what they got now?

817
01:11:11,434 --> 01:11:15,700
Devil's Night greeting cards.

818
01:11:15,772 --> 01:11:18,707
Isn't that precious?

819
01:11:18,775 --> 01:11:20,868
Yeah.

820
01:11:20,943 --> 01:11:25,710
The idea has become
the institution, boys.

821
01:11:25,782 --> 01:11:27,807
Time to move along.

822
01:11:27,884 --> 01:11:30,318
You don't want us to do
"Light My Fire" time for the whole city?

823
01:11:30,386 --> 01:11:32,877
No.

824
01:11:32,955 --> 01:11:35,549
No, I want you to set
a fire so goddamn big...

825
01:11:35,625 --> 01:11:38,719
the gods will notice us again.
That's what I'm saying.

826
01:11:38,795 --> 01:11:41,389
I want all of you boys to be able
to look me straight in the eye...

827
01:11:41,464 --> 01:11:45,901
one more time and say,
"Are we having fun or what?"

828
01:11:45,968 --> 01:11:48,061
- Hey, you! What's your name?
- Huh?

829
01:11:48,137 --> 01:11:50,071
Skank!
You don't feel that?

830
01:11:50,139 --> 01:11:53,438
- I feel like a little worm
on a big fuckin' hook.
- [ All Laughing ]

831
01:11:53,509 --> 01:11:55,909
"I feel like a little worm
on a big fuckin' hook."

832
01:11:55,978 --> 01:12:00,381
Well, boy, your mama
must be damn proud of you!

833
01:12:00,449 --> 01:12:02,781
- [ Crow Caws ]
- [ Gasps ]

834
01:12:02,852 --> 01:12:05,480
How the hell did
that thing get in here?

835
01:12:06,877 --> 01:12:09,368
- Gentlemen.
- [ Skank Screams ]

836
01:12:09,447 --> 01:12:14,077
[ Skank Whimpering ] Let me go!
Let me go! I gotta go!

837
01:12:18,656 --> 01:12:22,422
You're him, huh?
The avenger.

838
01:12:22,493 --> 01:12:24,984
The killer of killers.

839
01:12:25,062 --> 01:12:27,895
- Nice outfit.
- [ Whimpering ]

840
01:12:27,965 --> 01:12:30,024
I'm not sure
about the face though.

841
01:12:30,101 --> 01:12:32,160
I just want him.

842
01:12:32,236 --> 01:12:35,672
- [ Whimpering ]
- Well, you can't have him.

843
01:12:35,740 --> 01:12:38,402
Well...

844
01:12:40,478 --> 01:12:42,946
I see you have
made your decision.

845
01:12:44,515 --> 01:12:46,506
Now let's see you enforce it.

846
01:12:46,584 --> 01:12:50,247
Aw, this is already boring the shit
out of me. Kill him!

847
01:12:56,127 --> 01:13:00,063
Ooh, that had to hurt.

848
01:13:00,131 --> 01:13:02,929
- [ All Laughing ]
- Well, that's that.

849
01:13:03,000 --> 01:13:06,163
- [ Laughing Continues ]
- That guy was crazy.

850
01:13:08,506 --> 01:13:11,339
[ Caws ]

851
01:13:12,810 --> 01:13:14,607
He's gone.
[ Screams ]

852
01:13:14,678 --> 01:13:20,344
[ Screaming, Gunfire ]

853
01:13:22,653 --> 01:13:24,348
Get him!

854
01:13:29,827 --> 01:13:33,263
- [ Whimpering ]
- [ Gunfire ]

855
01:13:41,639 --> 01:13:44,403
Right here! Here, help me!
He's gonna kill me!

856
01:13:48,479 --> 01:13:50,470
Jesus Christ!

857
01:14:06,897 --> 01:14:08,865
Hey!

858
01:14:41,365 --> 01:14:43,697
You're all going to die.

859
01:14:55,112 --> 01:14:58,639
[ Screaming ]

860
01:14:58,716 --> 01:15:01,549
[ Man ] Get the fuck outta here!

861
01:15:13,831 --> 01:15:16,391
[ Crowd Screaming ]

862
01:15:16,467 --> 01:15:21,962
[ Whimpering, Gasping ]

863
01:15:26,577 --> 01:15:31,537
[ Whimpering ]

864
01:15:31,615 --> 01:15:33,105
[ Screams ]

865
01:15:37,321 --> 01:15:40,256
Guess it's not a good day
to be a bad guy, huh, Skank?

866
01:15:40,324 --> 01:15:43,555
I'm not Skank.
There's Skank right there.

867
01:15:43,627 --> 01:15:47,529
- Skank's dead.
- That's right.

868
01:15:47,598 --> 01:15:49,395
[ Screaming ] No!

869
01:15:49,466 --> 01:15:53,926
[ Whimpering ]

870
01:15:54,004 --> 01:15:57,667
- [ Body Crashing ]
- What in the crap--

871
01:15:59,009 --> 01:16:01,637
- Don't move!
- Hold it!

872
01:16:01,712 --> 01:16:05,148
That's all she wrote!
Move and we shoot!

873
01:16:12,022 --> 01:16:14,183
[ Siren Blaring ]

874
01:16:14,258 --> 01:16:17,125
You are surrounded by police units.
Do not attempt to escape.

875
01:16:17,194 --> 01:16:20,493
[ Gunfire Continues ]

876
01:16:20,564 --> 01:16:24,193
- Stop running immediately.
- Holy shit!

877
01:16:24,268 --> 01:16:26,395
...arms and legs--

878
01:16:31,976 --> 01:16:36,743
Stop immediately.
Lie down, spread your arms and legs--

879
01:17:17,388 --> 01:17:22,018
- [ Tires Screeching ]
- Come on! Move it!

880
01:17:26,430 --> 01:17:29,558
My advice:
Next time duck.

881
01:17:31,602 --> 01:17:33,968
So many cops, you'd think
they were giving away donuts.

882
01:17:34,038 --> 01:17:37,371
- [ Sirens Wailing ]
- [ Brakes Screeching ]

883
01:17:37,441 --> 01:17:40,535
- Shit!
- [ Door Opening ]

884
01:17:43,447 --> 01:17:46,348
Oh. I knew you
were gonna do that.

885
01:17:46,417 --> 01:17:48,885
Look at that out there.

886
01:17:48,952 --> 01:17:51,887
The whole city oughta be
in flames by now.

887
01:17:51,955 --> 01:17:55,152
Sky oughta be red.

888
01:17:55,225 --> 01:17:59,559
So that, I take it,
is the late, great Eric Draven.

889
01:17:59,630 --> 01:18:05,330
He has power, but it is power
you can take from him.

890
01:18:05,402 --> 01:18:08,371
- I like him already.
- The crow...

891
01:18:08,439 --> 01:18:12,933
is his link between
the land of the living...

892
01:18:13,010 --> 01:18:15,342
and the realm of the dead.

893
01:18:15,412 --> 01:18:19,940
So, kill the crow
and destroy the man.

894
01:18:20,017 --> 01:18:21,985
Hmm.

895
01:18:45,109 --> 01:18:47,100
I'm coming home, Shelly.

896
01:18:47,177 --> 01:18:49,372
[ Laughing ]

897
01:18:49,446 --> 01:18:55,146
[ Laughing Continues ]

898
01:18:55,219 --> 01:18:57,187
[ Chuckles ]

899
01:19:01,458 --> 01:19:05,656
[ Children Laughing, Hooting ]

900
01:19:05,729 --> 01:19:09,995
[ Laughing ]

901
01:19:36,193 --> 01:19:38,627
You're gonna say
I shouldn't be in the cemetery...

902
01:19:38,695 --> 01:19:40,754
in the middle
of the night, right?

903
01:19:40,831 --> 01:19:42,594
Safest place in the world to be.

904
01:19:42,666 --> 01:19:47,433
It's 'cause everybody's dead.
I knew you'd come here.

905
01:19:47,504 --> 01:19:51,668
It's really late, Sarah.

906
01:19:51,742 --> 01:19:54,504
You didn't say good-bye.

907
01:19:54,637 --> 01:19:58,596
You're just gonna have
to forgive me for that.

908
01:19:58,675 --> 01:20:02,907
And you're never coming back.

909
01:20:09,219 --> 01:20:12,450
I gave this to Shelly once.

910
01:20:16,192 --> 01:20:19,127
I think she'd like you
to have it.

911
01:20:23,199 --> 01:20:25,463
This way you'll
always remember her.

912
01:20:25,535 --> 01:20:28,095
I'll never take it off.

913
01:20:46,256 --> 01:20:50,090
I better go sneak
back in the house.

914
01:20:56,199 --> 01:20:58,167
Bye.

915
01:21:18,154 --> 01:21:20,987
- [ Muffled Screaming ]
- Shh! Shh!

916
01:21:22,892 --> 01:21:25,292
Shh. Take it easy, sweetheart.

917
01:21:25,361 --> 01:21:30,162
[ Muffled Screaming Continues ]

918
01:21:32,235 --> 01:21:34,703
Come on.
Come on.

919
01:21:47,984 --> 01:21:52,114
What is that? Some sort of souvenir
there from your pal?

920
01:21:53,723 --> 01:21:56,817
I'll just keep it for good luck.
What do you say, hmm?

921
01:22:03,266 --> 01:22:06,565
Her eyes are so innocent.

922
01:22:17,914 --> 01:22:19,848
- [ Sarah ] Eric!
- [ Caws ]

923
01:22:19,916 --> 01:22:23,875
Eric, help! Eric!

924
01:22:27,457 --> 01:22:30,551
[ Thunderclap ]

925
01:22:32,595 --> 01:22:34,529
[ Crow Caws ]

926
01:22:48,478 --> 01:22:50,673
[ Crow Flapping, Caws ]

927
01:23:03,593 --> 01:23:06,824
Quick impression for ya.

928
01:23:06,896 --> 01:23:10,627
Caw! Caw! Bang!
Fuck, I'm dead!

929
01:23:10,700 --> 01:23:14,033
Give me the girl
and I'll let you walk out of here.

930
01:23:14,103 --> 01:23:17,163
[ Inhales ]
Well, well.

931
01:23:17,240 --> 01:23:21,006
Why don't you just give me a minute
to think about that, huh?

932
01:23:25,448 --> 01:23:27,882
[ Cawing ]

933
01:23:28,951 --> 01:23:31,249
Nah. Fuck it.

934
01:23:37,260 --> 01:23:39,626
[ Chuckles ]

935
01:23:39,695 --> 01:23:41,856
Aw, fuck.

936
01:23:45,067 --> 01:23:49,026
[ Muffled Screaming ]

937
01:23:49,105 --> 01:23:53,633
Well, well, well. It does seem to me
that our little life has undergone...

938
01:23:53,709 --> 01:23:57,577
a rather significant change in the past
few minutes now. Wouldn't you agree?

939
01:23:57,647 --> 01:24:01,811
[ Groaning ]

940
01:24:01,884 --> 01:24:05,285
Well, for a ghost,
you bleed just fine.

941
01:24:08,824 --> 01:24:11,088
- It's still alive.
- Well, then kill it!

942
01:24:12,728 --> 01:24:14,958
Bye-bye, birdie.

943
01:25:00,042 --> 01:25:02,135
Ah, shit.

944
01:25:02,211 --> 01:25:04,304
Well, just came by
to pay my respects...

945
01:25:04,380 --> 01:25:06,405
and here you are
getting all shot up again.

946
01:25:06,482 --> 01:25:09,076
- They've taken Sarah.
- How many?

947
01:25:09,151 --> 01:25:11,142
Two more.
[ Groans ]

948
01:25:11,220 --> 01:25:13,211
I can handle it.
Don't worry.

949
01:25:13,289 --> 01:25:15,814
I'm not worried.
Look, here's the plan.

950
01:25:15,891 --> 01:25:18,655
You stay in front, and when they
run out of ammo, I'll arrest 'em.

951
01:25:18,728 --> 01:25:22,459
That sounds like a great plan.
There's just one problem.

952
01:25:25,067 --> 01:25:28,628
Oh, shit.
You're bleeding all over the place.

953
01:25:28,704 --> 01:25:30,763
I thought, you know,
you were invincible.

954
01:25:30,840 --> 01:25:34,298
I was.
I'm not anymore.

955
01:25:34,377 --> 01:25:38,609
[ Sighs ] Well, I guess you really will
need my help, won't you?

956
01:25:38,681 --> 01:25:41,582
- Come on.
- [ Groaning ]

957
01:25:44,253 --> 01:25:46,312
You take that.

958
01:26:16,385 --> 01:26:19,843
- You were supposed to stay behind me.
- I think I messed up.

959
01:26:41,977 --> 01:26:43,877
[ Crow Caws ]

960
01:26:43,946 --> 01:26:47,177
This is all the power
you ever had.

961
01:26:47,249 --> 01:26:49,342
Now it is mine.

962
01:26:49,418 --> 01:26:53,115
Pity there's not more time...

963
01:26:53,189 --> 01:26:55,817
- [ Gun Cocks ]
- ...for us.

964
01:26:57,259 --> 01:27:02,993
[ Woman Screaming ]

965
01:27:04,667 --> 01:27:08,603
[ Screaming ]

966
01:27:09,905 --> 01:27:13,864
[ Screaming Continues ]

967
01:27:13,943 --> 01:27:16,810
[ Sarah ] Help, Eric!
I'm scared!

968
01:27:18,914 --> 01:27:21,474
Let me go!

969
01:27:30,559 --> 01:27:34,086
Let her go!

970
01:27:36,068 --> 01:27:38,763
You can have me.
I won't fight you.

971
01:27:38,836 --> 01:27:40,827
All right.

972
01:27:40,905 --> 01:27:42,930
- [ Sarah Screams ]
- No!

973
01:27:46,744 --> 01:27:52,080
[ Gasping, Groaning ]

974
01:27:54,352 --> 01:27:56,411
[ Crow Caws ]

975
01:27:56,487 --> 01:27:58,853
[ Thunderclap ]

976
01:27:58,923 --> 01:28:01,255
[ Gasping ]

977
01:28:01,326 --> 01:28:03,453
- [ Thunderclap ]
- [ Screams ]

978
01:28:23,114 --> 01:28:25,981
[ Swords Clanking ]

979
01:28:26,050 --> 01:28:29,281
- [ Whimpering ]
- [ Roof Collapsing ]

980
01:28:29,354 --> 01:28:30,821
Eric!

981
01:28:33,191 --> 01:28:37,457
- [ Groaning ]
- [ Laughing ]

982
01:28:49,407 --> 01:28:52,740
- Sarah?
- Look out!

983
01:28:56,314 --> 01:28:59,841
- [ Panting ]
- Eric!

984
01:29:07,825 --> 01:29:10,020
You know,
my daddy used to say...

985
01:29:10,094 --> 01:29:12,585
"Every man's got a devil...

986
01:29:12,663 --> 01:29:14,824
and you can't rest
till you find him."

987
01:29:14,899 --> 01:29:17,424
What happened back there
with you and your girlfriend--

988
01:29:17,502 --> 01:29:20,437
I cleared that building.

989
01:29:20,505 --> 01:29:23,770
Hell, nothing in this town
happens without my say-so.

990
01:29:23,841 --> 01:29:26,708
So I'm sorry if I spoiled
your wedding plans, friend.

991
01:29:26,778 --> 01:29:29,611
But if it's any consolation
to you...

992
01:29:29,680 --> 01:29:33,309
you have put
a smile on my face.

993
01:29:33,384 --> 01:29:36,012
You got a lot
of spirit, son.

994
01:29:36,087 --> 01:29:38,681
[ Unsheathes Knife ]
I am going to miss you.

995
01:29:38,756 --> 01:29:41,281
I have something
to give you.

996
01:29:41,359 --> 01:29:43,759
I don't want it anymore.

997
01:29:48,232 --> 01:29:51,258
Thirty hours of pain!

998
01:29:53,604 --> 01:29:56,300
- All at once!
- [ Groaning ]

999
01:29:56,374 --> 01:29:59,400
- [ Steady Tone ]
- All for you.

1000
01:30:13,224 --> 01:30:16,660
[ Gasping ]

1001
01:30:25,002 --> 01:30:28,165
Yeah.

1002
01:30:35,012 --> 01:30:37,810
Go help him.

1003
01:30:41,185 --> 01:30:43,449
Are you alive?

1004
01:30:45,456 --> 01:30:49,449
[ Groans ]
God, I need a cigarette.

1005
01:30:55,433 --> 01:30:57,367
Everybody else dead?

1006
01:30:57,435 --> 01:30:59,733
You helped me.

1007
01:30:59,804 --> 01:31:02,364
What you kept in here
saved me.

1008
01:31:02,440 --> 01:31:05,568
- Thanks.
- Don't mention it.

1009
01:31:05,643 --> 01:31:08,635
I've been meaning
to come to church anyway.

1010
01:31:13,651 --> 01:31:16,415
Oh, yuck.
[ Spits ]

1011
01:31:16,487 --> 01:31:21,481
I'm quitting as of now...
if I live.

1012
01:31:29,967 --> 01:31:33,403
Stay with him
until help comes.

1013
01:31:33,471 --> 01:31:36,929
He'll be okay, right?

1014
01:31:37,008 --> 01:31:39,203
Eric?

1015
01:31:40,678 --> 01:31:44,273
[ Sighs ]
He does that a lot.

1016
01:31:46,150 --> 01:31:51,110
[ Distant Sirens Approaching ]

1017
01:31:51,188 --> 01:31:54,624
[ Gasping, Groaning ]

1018
01:31:54,692 --> 01:31:57,786
[ Tires Screeching ]

1019
01:32:00,531 --> 01:32:02,965
Shelly.

1020
01:32:15,212 --> 01:32:20,047
- All right, what's going on in there?
- Multiple homicides.

1021
01:32:20,117 --> 01:32:22,813
At least it stopped raining, huh?

1022
01:32:22,887 --> 01:32:26,288
- It can't rain all the time.
- No, I don't believe it.

1023
01:32:26,357 --> 01:32:29,690
- This nightmare your fault, Albrecht?
- Look, you go on home.

1024
01:32:29,760 --> 01:32:31,694
- I'm okay.
- Okay.

1025
01:32:31,762 --> 01:32:36,324
- Want to tell me what's going on?
- Your vigilante's up on the roof.

1026
01:32:36,400 --> 01:32:38,459
You missed it.

1027
01:32:38,536 --> 01:32:41,232
Get him outta here!

1028
01:32:41,305 --> 01:32:43,899
[ Chuckling ]

1029
01:33:45,403 --> 01:33:47,337
Thanks.

1030
01:33:52,576 --> 01:33:55,602
[ Sarah ] If the people we love
are stolen from us...

1031
01:33:55,680 --> 01:34:00,777
the way to have them live on
is to never stop loving them.

1032
01:34:00,851 --> 01:34:06,756
Buildings burn, people die,
but real love is forever.
